#Text=Pleven
#Text=Pleven
#Text=( Bulgarian : Плевен [ ˈplɛvɛn ] ) , a. k. a Plevna in Romanian , Plevne in Turkish , is a city in North Bulgaria .
#Text=Understand
#Text=Pleven is the seventh most populous city in Bulgaria with a bit over 110,000 inhabitants .
#Text=It is the biggest transportation and industrial centre in North Bulgaria .
#Text=Get in
#Text=Pleven lies on the Sofia - Varna railway .
#Text=Trains between Sofia and Rousse , as well as international trains towards Bucharest also stop in the city .
#Text=Buses between Sofia and Rousse , Bucharest , Svishtov and Silistra also usually make a stop at the bus station in Pleven .
#Text=Buses from Sofia depart roughly every hour until 18.00 from the central bus station in Sofia ( www .
#Text=centralnaavtogara . bg ) ( 10-13 BGN one way ) .
#Text=Advance purchase of tickets is usually not necessary , except during major holidays .
#Text=There are a few trains from Sofia every day ( www . bdz . bg ) .
#Text=These are usually slightly slower than the buses but pass through the beautiful Iskar gorge .
#Text=To Lovech there are frequent buses from the bus station in Pleven ( tel : +359.64.800.122 ) .
#Text=It is also possible to take the train there ( with a change in Levski ) , but that takes much longer .
#Text=The trains continue past Lovech to Troyan .
#Text=There are trains and buses to Rousse , trains ( and no buses ) to Varna and all cities on the railway , buses to Veliko Turnovo , Gabrovo , Svishtov , Razgrad , Belene , Kozloduy .
#Text=There are also one to two daily departures to Plovdiv and Bucharest , and at least in the summer to Burgas .
#Text=It is possible to cross to Romania through Rousse or with one of two daily buses to Oryahovo , then take the ferry over to Bechet .
#Text=Get around
#Text=Getting around the city on foot is quite straightforward .
#Text=The city is split by a long pedestrian street with many shops and service facilities .
#Text=There is also an extensive network of buses and trolley-buses .
#Text=A single ticket costs 0.70 BGN ( feb 2012 ) and you pay to a person on the bus .

#Text=Main trolley bus lines are numbers 3 and 7 ( running between Storgozia and Kaylaka , passing close to the train and bus stations ) and numbers 9 and 5 , which run between the train/bus station and Druzhba .
#Text=Taxis are generally cheap .
#Text=You would normally not pay more than 4 BGN within the city ( feb 2012 ) .
#Text=Make sure the driver puts the meter on .
#Text=There are numerous taxi stands in the centre and around many bus stops .
#Text=You can also call a taxi ( some numbers : 064 / 88-89 , 064 / 88-00 , 064 / 81-55-55 ) , but do not expect them to speak much English .
#Text=See
#Text=The Historical Museum in downtown Pleven hosts many exhibitions , including one on the famous Bulgarian soprano Ghena Dimitrova .

#Text=By far the most popular sight of Pleven is the Pleven Panorama , which depicts the events of the Russian-Turkish War of 1877 – 78 , specifically the five-month Siege of Plevna ( Pleven Epopee ) which made the city internationally famous and which contributed to the Liberation of Bulgaria after five centuries of Ottoman rule .
#Text=During the summer the many fountains and a water cascade on the central pedestrian street are a favourite place for relaxation among locals .
#Text=Pleven is famous for its Kaylaka ( where the ruins of the Storgosia fortification can be found ) and Skobelev parks .
#Text=The latter is home to the Pleven Panorama and was where most of the battles took place .
#Text=The Kaylaka park is very popular among locals .
#Text=There is a zoo , a pond where you can rent a boat and row , tennis courts , bicycle lanes , perfect places for picnics or playing games .
#Text=There are a few hiking trails around , up to some cliffs and caves .
#Text=If you want to spend a couple of days relaxing in the park , also consider staying at the nearby hostel .
#Text=From the city you can either walk or take trolley buses 3 or 7 to their last stop .

#Text=A very interesting and somewhat underestimated sight is the ' Svetlin Rusev Donative Exhibition ' ( Bulgarian : Изложба-дарение „ Светлин Русев “ , Izlozhba-darenie „ Svetlin Rusev “ ) , which includes the personal collection of the famous Bulgarian artist .
#Text=It includes works by Pablo Picasso , Francisco Goya , Honoré Daumier , Marc Chagall , Maurice Denis , Pierre-Auguste Renoir , Salvador Dalí and Renato Guttuso , among others .
#Text=Admission is free !
#Text=Outside the village of Gigen , close to Pleven , lie the ruins of the Roman town of Oescus .
#Text=Eat
#Text=Pizzeria Signorina
#Text=( пицария Синьорина ) , ул . Ал .
#Text=Стамболийски 1 ( very close to the military club ( see Sleep section ) , up the street on the left side . ) .
#Text=Good pizzas and other meals .
#Text=The place is known for displaying the two largest jigsaw puzzles in the world ( 36000 and 24000 pieces ) .
#Text=Sleep
#Text=There are a few hotels in the city and not many budget options such as hostels .
#Text=The cheapest option is a hostel ( tourist house ) in the Kayluka park , outside of the city .

#Text=The two best known hotels in the city , catering mostly to the business crowd are Rostov ( http://www.rostov.bg/ ) and Balkan ( http://hotel-balkan.com/index.php?lang=en , has prices from € 15 per person ) .
#Text=Both are 3-star hotels .
#Text=Military Club
#Text=( Военен Клуб ) , main square ( at the far end of the main square , opposite the municipality building , close do Doyran blvd ) , ☏ +35964831367 .
#Text=Very central location .
#Text=Basic rooms in the military club ( rated as a 1 star hotel ) .
#Text=50 BGN for a single , 60 BGN for a double room ( Feb 2012 ) .
#Text=Hostel Kaylaka
#Text=( Туристически дом Кайлъка ) , park Kaylaka ( It is a bit out of town , close to the entrence to the beautiful park Kaylaka .
#Text=You can take trolley bus nr . 7 or 3 to the last stop and walk from there ) , ☏ +35964834352 , +359 878 75 80 37 ( mobile ) .
#Text=Basic hotel , accommodating mostly groups .
#Text=Has a restaurant .
#Text=Cheapest option in Pleven .
#Text=Very important :
#Text=If you ask for directions or take a taxi , make sure they do not confuse it with a way more luxurious hotel Kaylaka , which is further away inside the park .
#Text=20-70 BGN .
#Text=Single room : 20/30 BGN ( with/without TV ) , Double room : 45 BGN , Triple room : 50 BGN , Quadruple room : 55 BGN , Apartment : 70 BGN .
#Text=Hotel Face
#Text=, 12 Svoboda sq . /площад Свобода 12 ( very central , on the main pedestrian street , across from a restaurant called Speedy ) , ☏ +35964801613 .
#Text=Small and clean rooms .
#Text=Perfect location .
#Text=50-100 BGN ( single , double , apartments ) .
